Class embedding the addChild function, hence allowing the undo/redo functionalities

Adds a child to the currently selected graphical representation of a primitive, hence adding it into the model.

Reason : in switch(switch bins etc), adding numerous child can be useful

class LSD_inputGUI.src.editor.AdvancedTreeEditor.CommandDropChild(parentView, itemModified, newPrimitiveName, description='Replace child')[source]¶

Class embedding the dropChild function, hence allowing the undo/redo functionalities. If first ever call to redo, use current tree information to make modifications. Else, just reload the tree using a dom as done in the undo function.

redo()[source]¶

Replace child primitive by the one being dropped on it

undo()[source]¶

Undo replace child operation.

class LSD_inputGUI.src.editor.AdvancedTreeEditor.CommandPaste(parentView, description='Paste')[source]¶

Class embedding the paste function, hence allowing the undo/redo functionalities.

redo()[source]¶

Paste function. Looks if a MedTreeItem is currently selected and pastes MainEditorWindow’s clipboard content, if there is one, onto currently selected MedTreeItem.

undo()[source]¶

Undo paste operation.

class LSD_inputGUI.src.editor.AdvancedTreeEditor.MedTreeComboBox(parent)[source]¶

This class is a comboBox embed in a ProxyWidget. Most of its is reimplemented from QtGui.QGraphicsProxyWidget It is used as a graphical way for the user to present a list of primitive that can replace its associated node

class LSD_inputGUI.src.editor.AdvancedTreeEditor.MedTreeCross(position, dimension, parent=None)[source]¶

This class is a graphical representation of a cross/minus sign. Most of it is reimplemented from QGraphicsWidget. It is used as a graphical way for the user to fold/unfold parts of the tree.

boundingRect()[source]¶

Reimplementation of QGraphicsView.boundingRect(self) virtual function. Required to correctly paint the graphic item.

fakePress(state)[source]¶

Function changes activation status, adjust layout if not hidden yet. Called by the redo/undo system, to adjuste a newly created tree to a previous/posterior state.

Parameters:
  • state – Tells if the state is enabled or not.
  • state – Boolean
mousePressEvent(event)[source]¶

Function changes activation status and forwards it to its parent children. It also allows the appropriate geometry change(updating the position) of the Tree.

Parameters:event – see QGraphicsWidget’s documentation for more information.

  • widget – see QGraphicsWidget’s doc for details.
shape()[source]¶

Reimplementation of QGraphicsView.shape(self) virtual function. Allows the correct propagation of mouse event.

class LSD_inputGUI.src.editor.AdvancedTreeEditor.MedTreeEditableBranchTag(parent, text='')[source]¶

This class is a graphical representation of a switch value for primitives Switch, SwitchBins and DynnamicBranch. When such primitives have switch values, those values are located left to the MedTreeItem, aligned with the horizontal branch line . Most of it is reimplemented from QGraphicsTextItem.

calculateTextWidth()[source]¶

Calculates the width taken by the switch value and adjusts position.

Parameters:event – see QGraphicsTextItem documentation for more information.

Parameters:event – see QGraphicsTextItem’s doc for details.
mousePressEvent(event)[source]¶

Reimplementation of QGraphicsTextItem.mousePressEvent(self,event) virtual function. Enter Edit Mode if branch tag doesn’t refer to a reference attribute.

Parameters:event – see QGraphicsTextItem documentation for more information.

updateBranchTag()[source]¶

This slot is called when a primitive switch values have been modified.

class LSD_inputGUI.src.editor.AdvancedTreeEditor.MedTreeItem(position, dimension, parent=None)[source]¶

This class is a graphical representation of a xml node in a QGraphicsView. Most of it is reimplemented from QGraphicsWidget.

boundingRect()[source]¶

Reimplementation of QGraphicsWidget.boundingRect(self) virtual function. Required to correctly paint the graphic item.

collapseSubTree(updateLayout=False)[source]¶

This functions prepares the folding of a branch. First, it looks for the MedTreeCross associated with the branch. Once found, it sets its activation state to False. Afterward, It calls it’s _expOrCollapse function that will allow the propagation of the activation status. Finally, if needed, it will call a layoutUpdate on the MedTreeCross.

Parameters:updateLayout (Boolean) – If false, we want to perform this action without updating the general layout of the Tree.

By example, when we add a new SubTree to a Primitive, we will first collapse the subTree. Since this new subTree isn’t yet part of the Tree, we don’t want the general Layout to be updated, hence the utility of the updateLayout parameter.

dumpModelInfos()[source]¶

Debug function. Print self.primitive information in the console.

expandSubTree(updateLayout=False)[source]¶

This functions prepares the expand of a branch. First, it looks for the MedTreeCross associated with the branch. Once found, it sets its activation state to True. Afterward, it will call a layoutUpdate on the MedTreeCross. Finally, It calls it’s _expOrCollapse function that will allow the propagation of the activation status.

Parameters:updateLayout (Boolean) – If false, we want to perform this action without updating the general layout of the Tree.

Note: _expOrCOllapse, if compared to the collapseSubTree function, is called after the update : since the layoutUpdate function calls the _calculateAmoutOfSpace function which itself relies on the visible status to calculate the amount of space used or released by a collapse/expand action, we first have to calculate the amount of space that will be used by the “invisible subTree” before setting the branch and all of its subTree visible

getColumn()[source]¶

This function returns self’s relative column

getRow()[source]¶

This function returns self’s relative row

lookForLineModif()[source]¶

Function allowing a MedTreeItem with multiple line objects to update its vertical line.

manageAsterisk()[source]¶

Manage asterisk that indicates whether or not primitive has a user comment

manageBranchTag()[source]¶

Adds a branch tag to subtree or update one if already present.

Reimplementation of QGraphicsWidget.moveBy(self, dx, dy) virtual function. Function calls parent’s class moveBy implementation.

Parameters:

  • dy (QReal) – Number of points to move vertically

paintHook()[source]¶

If an error is found in the model this function is called. Hence, the item is repainted and changes colour, keeping the tree view and the model synced.

reInitialize(primitive)[source]¶

Method called by the undo function. Allows a tree with invalid primitive pointer to correctly re-initialize.

Parameters:primitive – new primitive to set.
setParentItem(parentItem, appendToEndOfList=True)[source]¶

Reimplementation of QGraphicsWidget.setParentItem(self,parentItem). Parent primitive keeps a list of its MedTreeItem children.

Parameters:
  • parentItem (MedTreeItem) – parent MedTreeItem.
  • appendToEndOfList (Boolean) – if set to False, user will have to correctly manage the graphicalPmtList.
setPrimitive(primitive)[source]¶

Set basePmtModel’s primitive instance associated with this graphical object :param primitive: basePmtModel’s primitive instance

Reimplementation of QGraphicsView.boundingRect(self) virtual function. Allows the correct propagation of mouse event.

class LSD_inputGUI.src.editor.AdvancedTreeEditor.MedTreeView(domNode=<PyQt4.QtXml.QDomNode object at 0x7f58afb66588>, mainWindow=None)[source]¶

This class is responsible of controlling the refresh of a QGraphicsScene and the interactions of the user with the scene. Most of it is reimplemented from QGraphicsView. This class allows a user-friendly display of a xml file. This class implements tools to allow quick and easy modification of xml files.

addChild()[source]¶

Add a child at the end of the current item.

addMultipleChildren(numChildToAdd)[source]¶

Add multiple children at the end of the current item.

Parameters:numChildToAdd (Int) – Number of children to add.
addSiblingAfter()[source]¶

Add a sibling just after the current item.

addSiblingBefore()[source]¶

Add a sibling just before the current item.

copy()[source]¶

Simple copy function. Looks if a MedTreeItem is currently selected and pastes it(and all its subtree) to MainEditorWindow’s clipboard variable.

cut()[source]¶

Simple cut function.

dragEnterEvent(event)[source]¶

Reimplementation of virtual function QtGraphicsView.dragEnterEvent(self,event). Ensure event come from a MedListView.

Parameters:event – see QGraphicsView documentation for more information.
dragLeaveEvent(event)[source]¶

Reimplementation of virtual function QtGraphicsView.dragLeaveEvent(self,event). This function just ignores the event. If it doesn’t ignore it, Qt will complain receiving a dragLeaveEvent before a dragEnterEvent.

Parameters:event – see QGraphicsView documentation for more information.
dropEvent(event)[source]¶

Reimplementation of virtual function QtGraphicsView.droptEvent(self,event). Takes MimeData previously created by the drag event from a MedList.

Main idea :
  • do nothing if the drop operation comes from a drag event initiated by self(medTreeView).
  • ensure the drop event landed on a MedTreeItem, a graphical representation of a primitive.
  • Create CommandDropChild, that will take care of the model and tree management.
Parameters:event – see QGraphicsView documentation for more information.
generalUpdate()[source]¶
Call three update functions :
  • Update properties <MedTreeView.updateProperties()>
  • Update comments and definitions <MedTreeView.updateComAndDef()>
  • Update error log <MedTreeView.updateErrorLog()>
getLocVarModel()[source]¶

Return Local Variable Model associated with this tree. Create one if it doesn’t exist.

Returns:LocVarsModel.
keyPressEvent(event)[source]¶

Reimplementation of virtual function QtGraphicsView.dragLeaveEvent(self,event). Test which key(s) has been pressed and call corresponding function.

Parameters:event – see QGraphicsView documentation for more information
mouseDoubleClickEvent(event)[source]¶

Reimplementation of QGraphicsView’.mouseDoubleClickEvent(self,event) virtual function. Open a new MedTreeView if clicked primitive has a doubleClickBehavior(TokenCallProcess and TokenPushProcess for the moment).

Parameters:event – see QGraphicsView documentation for more information
mousePressEvent(event)[source]¶

Reimplementation of QGraphicsView.mousePressEvent(self,event) virtual function.

Main idea : a mouse press event can be performed to choose a primitive so the user can see its attributes(properties). Hence, call an update on the properties/error/definition/comment tabs.

Parameters:event – see QGraphicsView documentation for more information

Simple paste function.

Prints a .svg of the tree if the parameter svgFilePath is not empty.

Parameters:svgFilePath (String.) – filePath we want the picture to be saved to.
save()[source]¶

Saves DOM.

saveLocals()[source]¶

Saves Local Variables.

updateComAndDef()[source]¶

Create and show the widgets that contain the definition of the currently selected variable and the comment associated to it, if any

updateDirtyState()[source]¶

Look if file is dirty. It means, if modifications have been made since the last save.

If so, add asterisk(*) to tab’s name

updateErrorLog()[source]¶

Create the error log located next to the Properties tab

updateProperties()[source]¶

Create and show the widgets that contain the information about currentItem’s primitive attributes

Reimplementation of QGraphicsView.wheelEvent(self,event) virtual function. Allow Ctrl-wheel to scroll horizontally, else do as usual.

Parameters:event – see QGraphicsView documentation for more information
